results.title: The Social Costs of Solar Radiation Management
results.summary: This article argues that Solar Radiation Management (SRM) costs more than its technical aspects suggest. It highlights potential side-effect harms, the need for unprecedented international cooperation, political accountability for weather events, and termination risks. The study suggests that Large-Scale Carbon Dioxide Removal (LCDR) may be a more viable alternative when considering the holistic costs and risks, framing the debate within the context of climate intervention strategies. results.title: Assessing the Impact of Trump's Tariffs on U.S. Economic Growth and Key Sectors
results.summary: This MarketPulse article assesses the impact of Trump's tariffs (2017-2025) on U.S. economic growth, noting short-term volatility and long-term structural risks. Tariffs on steel/aluminum raised manufacturing costs, while those on drugs/semiconductors led to tech sector sell-offs. Long-term risks include reduced global competitiveness and China's tech self-reliance. Investors should diversify sectors and hedge geographically. The article states, "the U.S. economic model cannot afford to rely on protectionism alone." Remember to refer to the original source and proceed with spiritual discernment.
